column4: i upgraded from ubuntu dapper to edgy but the 'show updates' function doesn't work it does nothing. any ideas?
all other functions of the update-manager work fine. like install updates
it's just that i can't use show updates to see the updates
Does it gives an error message?
nothing. it just asks for a password like any other gksudo program and then does nothing
if you can give me the command line for 'show updates' i can see if it results in any errors
And you are sure the sources.list is ok?
i don't know i haven't checked :\ i've been downloading updates without problems though
it complains of duplicate entries in sources.list
You can try. Backup sources.list first... :)
ok apparently it was one automatix line that created the duplicate entries
well now it thinks a package manager is working but nothing appears to be running let me check ps
nope it still isn't working. hovering notifies that there are 4 available updates. but show updates still doesn't do anything
there are no other running package managers.
